html:
1. Enter the step name, select Filter-Table as Function, then select the input table from Input Table dropdown.
  2. Enter any name for a new output table creation or remove the new option and select the available tables from Output table dropdown.
  3. Click on plus symbol (+) beside New column name to Add new query in Exclude screen.
  4. Condition builder in Exclude:
    1. Select the column name displayed under Columns which has to be excluded.
    2. Select any operator from Operators based on the desired condition.
    3. Type in the values (for string, enter the values in single quotes) in Add text field click on Add to display in the Condition.
    4. Save the query on clicking the right symbol (✔) after the condition is built. OR (e to f)
    5. Select a valid rule from the Rule box.
    6. Applicable rules- DATE, DAY, MONTH.
    7. the required inputs according to the selected rule.
    8. similar process steps- 4.b, 4.c and Save the Condition.
  5. But Include- the optional step:
    1. Repeat the step no 3 on But Include screen.
    2. Repeat similar process steps as mentioned in step no 4 for another column.
  6. Execute the query by clicking Run Process Step button.

1. Enter the step name, select Merge Tables as Function, then select one of the multiple input tables as first Input Table.
  2. Enter any name for a new output table creation or remove the new option and select the available tables from Output table dropdown.
  3. Click on plus symbol (+) beside New column name to Add new query in On Lookup screen.
  4. Expression builder in On Lookup:
    1. Select the column name of the first input table from Columns.
    2. Select the comma operator from Operators.
    3. Change the input table and select the similar named column from Columns.
    4. Save the query on clicking the right symbol (✔) after the expression is built.
  5. Criteria- the optional step:
    1. Repeat the step no 3 on Criteria screen.
    2. Type in the texts – Left, Right or Inner in Add text field click on Add to display the text in Expression.
    3. Save the query on clicking the right symbol (✔).
  6. Execute the query by clicking Run Process Step button.

1. Enter the step name, select If-Then-Else as Function, then select the input table from Input Table dropdown.
  2. Enter any name for a new output table creation or remove the new option and select the available tables from Output table dropdown.
  3. Click on plus symbol (+) beside New column name to Add new query in If, Then & Else
  4. Condition builder in If:
    1. Select the column name displayed under Columns on which the ‘if’ condition has to be applied.
    2. Select any operator from Operators based on the desired condition.
    3. Type in the values (for string, enter the values in single quotes) in Add text field click on Add to display in the Condition.
    4. Save the query on clicking the right symbol (✔) after the condition is built.
  5. Expression builder in Then:
    1. Enter a new column name in New column name field where the results of the expression have to be displayed.
    2. Select any applicable valid rule from the Rule box based on the target column values.
    3. Enter the required inputs according to the selected rule and save the query. OR
    4. Create any expression by selecting the column and similar operations and save the query.
  6. Else- the optional step:
    1. Enter the same column name inside the New column as entered in Then
    2. Select different but similar type of operations from the Rule column (ref: step no 5.b, 5.c)
    3. OR in the expression builder which are to be applied on same or different columns.
    4. Create and save the query.
  7. Execute the query by clicking Run Process Step button.

1. Enter the step name, select Math as Function, then select the input table from Input Table dropdown.
  2. Enter any name for a new output table creation or remove the new option and select the available tables from Output table dropdown.
  3. Click on plus symbol (+) beside New column name to Add new query in Formula
  4. Expression builder in Formula:
    1. Enter a new column name in New column name field where the results of the expression have to be displayed.
    2. Select the column name displayed under Columns on which the condition has to apply.
    3. Select any operator from Operators based on the desired condition.
    4. Type in the values (for string, enter the values in single quotes) in Add text field click on Add to display in the Expression. OR
    5. Select a valid rule based on the target column from the Rule box after completing 4.a.
    6. Applicable rules- Average, Count, MAX, MID, MIN, ROUND, ROUNDDOWN, ROUNDUP, SUM
    7. Enter the required inputs according to the selected rule and save the query in the Expression.
    8. Save the query on clicking the right symbol (✔) after the condition is built.
  5. Execute the query by clicking Run Process Step button.

1. Enter the step name, select Text-String as Function, then select the input table from Input Table dropdown.
  2. Enter any name for a new output table creation or remove the new option and select the available tables from Output table dropdown.
  3. Click on plus symbol (+) beside New column name to Add new query in Formula & Condition
  4. Expression builder in Formula:
    1. Enter a new column name in New column name field where the results of the expression have to be displayed.
    2. Select a valid rule based on the target column from the Rule box.
    3. Applicable rules- RENAME_COL, CONCAT, CONTAINS, LEN, TRIM, LEFT, RIGHT, MID, DAY, DATE, DAYS_DIFF, EO_MON, PLUS_DAYS, MINUS_DAYS, MONTH
    4. Enter the required inputs according to the selected rule and save the query in the Expression.
    5. Save the query on clicking the right symbol (✔) after the condition is built.
  5. Condition- the optional step:
    1. Enter a new column name in New column name field where the results of the expression have to be displayed.
    2. Select the column name displayed under Columns on which the condition has to apply.
    3. Select any operator from Operators based on the desired condition.
    4. Type in the values (for string, enter the values in single quotes) in Add text field click on Add to display in the Expression.
  6. Execute the query by clicking Run Process Step button.

1. Upload files (excel, csv) which contains duplicate values in one or more columns.
  2. Enter the step name, select Unique-Columns as Function, then select the input table from Input Table dropdown.
  3. Enter any name for a new output table creation or remove the new option and select the available tables from Output table dropdown.
  4. Click on plus symbol (+) beside New column name to Add new query in Columns
  5. Expression builder in Columns:
    1. Select single or multiple column names displayed under Columns to apply the condition.
    2. Select comma (,) from Operators for multiple column selection.
    3. Save the query on clicking the right symbol (✔) after the condition is built.
  6. Execute the query by clicking Run Process Step button.

1. Enter the step name, select Combine Tables as Function.
  2. Input Table field should be disabled.
  3. Enter any name for a new output table creation or remove the new option and select the available tables from Output table dropdown.
  4. Click on plus symbol (+) beside New column name to Add new query in Tables
  5. Column Name field should be disabled to enter any new column name.
  6. Expression builder in Tables:
    1. Select the table names (input file names for multiple input source files).
    2. Save the query on clicking the right symbol (✔) after the expression is built.
  7. Execute the query by clicking Run Process Step button.

1. Enter the step name, select Search Map as Function, then select one of the multiple input tables as first Input Table.
  2. Enter any name for a new output table creation in Output table.
  3. Click on plus symbol (+) beside New column name to Add new query in Column
  4. Expression builder in Column:
    1. Select the column name of the first input table from Columns on which Search Map to be performed.
    2. Add a comma in the Expression after the selected and displayed column name in 4.I.
      1. Click on Manual Query button
      2. Type in comma (,) in the manual query builder text field and click on
    3. Change the input table and select the second table name.
    4. Select the column name of the second input table from Columns on which Search Map to be performed.
    5. Save the query on clicking the right symbol (✔) after the expression is built.
  5. Execute the query by clicking Run Process Step button.

1. Enter the step name, select Pivot-Table as Function, then select the input table from Input Table
  2. Enter a different name for a new output table creation in Output Table.
  3. Click on plus symbol (+) beside New column name to add new query in Rows, Values & Conditions
  4. Expression builder in Search Value:
    1. Enter the Key Name from where the search to be started.
    2. Enter the count for the target search from Key Name.
    3. Click on Add Query to display the expression in Expression
    4. Save the query on clicking the right symbol (✔) after the condition is built.
  5. Expression builder in Values:
    1. Enter a new column name in New column name.
    2. Select a Mathematical rule from Rules box:
      1. SUM, AVERAGE, COUNT, MAX, MIN
    3. Select single column (numeric) displayed under Columns.
    4. Save the query on clicking the right symbol (✔) after the expression is built.
  6. Condition (optional step)- to create some condition like filter:
    1. Select any column from Columns to apply the condition.
    2. Select any operator from Operators.
    3. Type in the values (for string, enter the values in single quotes) in Value text field click on Add to display in the Condition.
    4. Save the query on clicking the right symbol (✔) after the condition is built.
  7. Execute the query by clicking Run Process Step button.

1. Enter the step name, select Search-PDF as Function, then select the input table from Input Table
  2. Enter a different name for a new output table creation in Output Table.
  3. Click on plus symbol (+) beside New column name to add new query in Search Value
  4. Expression builder in Search Value:
    1. Enter the Key Name from where the search to be started.
    2. Enter the count for location of the target search from Key Name
    3. Click on Add button to enter more similar parameters in the expression.
    4. Click on Add Query to display the expression in Expression
    5. Save the query on clicking the right symbol (✔) after the expression is built.
  5. Execute the query by clicking Run Process Step button.
